thread.title: Calgary Flames rookie Sam Bennett eases concern over shoulder
thread.title_full: Calgary Flames rookie Sam Bennett eases concern over shoulder

title: Calgary Flames rookie Sam Bennett eases concern over shoulder
text:
Report an error 
The injury which kept Sam Bennett from playing on Saturday was reportedly a shoulder issue. 
The Calgary Flames rookie wouldn’t confirm that as being fact, but would state for the record, though, what the mysterious “upper-body” injury wasn’t. 
“I can confirm it’s not my repaired shoulder,” said Bennett, who missed most of last season after shoulder surgery. 
In turn, expect Bennett to be back in action when the Flames play host to the Washington Capitals Tuesday night at the Saddledome (7 p.m., Sportsnet 360/Sportsnet 960 The Fan), and he may not be the lone player to return to action. 
Forward Joe Colborne, who suffered a broken right thumb after he blocked a shot in the pre-season, practised fully on Monday and could get the green light. 
“It felt great today. Shooting and everything, I don’t notice it any more,” Colborne said. 
The benefit of missing the last few weeks is that Colborne’s left wrist, for which he had surgery in the off-season, had more time to heal. 
“It’s way better than it was,” Colborne reported. “Like I said when (the thumb injury) happened, that was the only silver lining, that gave more of a chance to get better. I’m shooting it way better than I was during training camp, so it’s made some improvements.” 
Not on the ice for Monday’s skate at WinSport was left-winger Micheal Ferland, who was at the facility. 
Coach Bob Hartley said Ferland missed the practice due to “maintenance” and suggested it wouldn’t prevent the winger from playing in the game.
